manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: You need a Safety and High Quality Phone Tripod Mount ,No ,not only about that ,and a Multi-function and Pocket Size Phone Holder . Yes ,You need Ulanzi ST-03. A new patent Pocket Size design with CNC machined from solid aluminum quality ,Phone is locked in place with a steel bolt (not a spring!)And a Hidden Cold Shoe Mount Design. What`s More ,It can Hold smartphones from 2.28" to 4.1" wide,even the 7in screen phones. Holds any smart phone from 2.28" to 4.1" wide. Compatible with 4.3in to 7in Screen Smartphone.The ST-03 cell phone holder can be attached to any standard tripod (1/4-20), and can secure your cell phone for photos, videos or being used as a webcam or car GPS.
What is in the box? 1x Ulanzi ST-03 Metal Phone Tripod Mount

With Patent Hidden Cold Shoe Mount Design,You can Mount the Video Microphone and Led Video Light or a Gopro on the Top of Phone Mount . The Best Pocket Size----With the folded length of 106mm ,width 38mm and weights only 86.8g. This compact ST-03 can be carried in pocket easily . Compatible with Benro Gitzo Manfrotto RRS Arca Swiss Tripod Ball Head.

Holds any smart phone from 2.56" to 4.1" wide. Compatible with 4.3in to 7in Screen Smartphone.The ST-03 cell phone holder can be attached to any standard tripod (1/4-20), and can secure your cell phone for photos, videos or being used as a webcam or car GPS.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect design for my use.
reviews.reviewText: I'm a big fan of Ulanzi products for the price point and the great quality of the products I've purchased from them in the past, and this cellphone clamp is no different.My favorite feature on this is the fact that they designed it so that you no longer need a mounting plate for your tripod as the mount is built into the base of the unit! (As long as you have a clamp style head on your tripod!)I purchased this to use on my 3 Legged Thing tripod and it fits the head perfectly. The clamp itself is lage enough to facilitate very large phones, and the fact that it folds down so compact is great if you're on the go. 10/10 would buy again!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works well with Samsung S23ultra
reviews.reviewText: Well made and holds phone securely without fear of damage because you control the amount of pressure applied to the phone.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Study Camera Holder
reviews.reviewText: I love this camera mount! It is sturdy, works well with my iPhone SE device, and looks good too! I have not used it a lot yet, but the times that I have, it has worked perfectly! I would definitely suggest this to anyone looking for a good phone mount.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great but not perfect.
reviews.reviewText: First, it looks great. I got the red one, and it's pretty great-looking. I like its sturdy aluminum build, its form factor is efficient, and well-built. I have a Google Pixel 7 with a fairly slim Moment case, and this fits sideways with no problem. Seems secure, though I don't really walk around with it. It sits on a small tripod on a table. I like the "hidden" cold shoe for accessories on top, because I do attach a mic and light to it. It only has one shoe, I attach the mic to the light's shoe. My cons are minor. My Pixel 7 does not fit vertically in the holder, and there is no swivel to flip the phone 90 degrees. It's a minor con, because I don't usually record vertically. But the option would be nice. This one isn't solely on the holder, but, the arms the hold the phone take up a bit of room, causing the phone to have to sit off-center because of the power and volume buttons. Not a big deal, but thought I'd note it. Overall it's a pretty great phone holder, and depending on your phone, I'd recommend it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I love how sturdy it is because it is made of metal. The screw, the handle, everything are made of metal and there is a little cushion to protect the phone. The only drawback is that it takes forever to unscrew it if you have a big phone, which is the most common phone nowadays. Even that, I still love it and use it all the time because it gives me a peace of mind knowing my phone won't fall off the bracket 😀

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 26, 2020
reviews.reviewText: I was looking for an inexpensive device that would allow me to use my Arca-Swiss-style ball head with an iPhone. This one seemed worth a try for the price, but I didn't expect it to be nearly as good was what I received.It's very nicely designed and well-made, the moving parts fit tightly and line up very nicely, so the phone fits snugly when I close the clamp down.The screw mechanism works fine, the pieces are a bit loose in that there's quite a bit of play in this part of the item, but it doesn't appear to be a concern. Using the screw to move the clamp up or down initially was very squeaky and not smooth, but a bit of 3-1 oil sorted that right out and now the movement is quiet.The one other element that isn't just right (besides the looseness of the screw and guide rods) is that the bottom plate doesn't fit as smoothly into the ball head as my other Arca-Swiss plates. I have several plates for mounting DSLR bodies and various lenses, and each of these (albeit more expensive) plates has a slightly narrower base which allows the plates to fit more easily into the ball head. The Ulanzi base plate is wider than my other plates and too wide to place into the ball head's clamp from the top as I'm accustomed to doing. I have to slide the Ulanzi into the ball head's clamp, and then because the Ulanzi fits the space so tightly there is not much room to snug the ball head's clamp down. This is not much of an issue because a phone is very light and you don't need a lot of torque on the clamping screw. But it still feels a bit weird compared to using the other plates which, being slightly narrower, allow me to crank down on the clamping screw for a very tight fit.Overall I'm very pleased with the item and recommend it if you want to use a phone on your Arca-Swiss ball head.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Exactly what I needed!
reviews.reviewText: I needed the cell phone mount for my teleprompter - the one it came with was plastic and broke. ULANZI ST-03 Metal Smart Phone Tripod Mount worked great! It has a slim profile so it fits well. It's metal, so it's much stronger than the plastic one. It's also easy to use. Love it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great product just wish there were more colors
reviews.reviewText: Been using daily for awhile now. The magnets hold the phone very well and the stand is very sturdy and balanced. Only downside is that it's only available in one color.

After looking a numerous different mounting options, I went with simplicity. It suits my needs. Everyone is different you may like more features on a mount. However it works for me. Good quality, all metal, secure.Arrived quickly. I happy with my purchase.

reviews.reviewTitle: Solid and reliable , convenient for travel
reviews.reviewText: Very solid and compact, why bought for travel. Expensive cellphone goes on these and much prefer a screw type than a spring tension ones (seen some falling off !!!).Just watch is tight enough and if phone fit properly.
De muy buena calidad, muy practico, cumplió todas mis espectativas

Bought this to use my phone on arca-swiss clamps of my manfrotto pixi and full size tripod. Serves it's purpose beautifully. I don;t have to buy a arca-swiss plate + phone clamp separately now.Construction is all metal and the screws and hinges are nicely damped. One good thing is once you expand the clamp to accomodate your phone, the top portion of the camp is tight and doesn't fall back if the phone is not there.Along with the arc-swiss mount, it has a thread at the base to attach in non-arca style tripod/monopods too. Very nice touch. Only thing is price could've been little less.Overall v nice product.

It does what the manufacture says it will be do. But handle it with care. On my unit, it was hard to at first extend the arms I accidentally cut myself on the sharp aluminum edges trying to force it open. There are no instructions with it. I sprayed WD40 on it to make it easier to open which should be unnecessary.For what you get and the trouble I had, it's overpriced.
